Senior software and InfoSec leader in business development, sales, and  c-level management helping grow innovative and entrepreneurial spirited companies with capital funding, S&M, finance, operations management, product GTM strategies, and everything else needed to ensure companies can achieve success in the markets they penetrate while growing top-line revenues and improve EBITDA margins in the process  .
Serving my 4th term as Board Member to advance technology and tech investment in AZ.

CEO of Lynx Technology Partners, an InfoSec consulting and IT Risk Management & IT GRC Software Company where I was responsible for managing the company, formulating and executing short & long-term  strategies, interacting with Fortune 5,000 and Federal Government clients, employees, and other stakeholders. I was also engaged in all M&A activities while working with a premier banker in the InfoSec spaceFor the past 17 months, I led a great team of true experts in the field of InfoSec, IT governance, compliance, and mitigation.  The primary mission to to solve customer IT security compliance pains, which inevitably will continue to propel Lynx  as one of America's fastest growing security and compliance companies, as recently validated by Lynx being recognized as the 80th fastest growing private company in the US on the Inc. 5000 list (http://www.inc.com/profile/lynx-technology-partners), listed on the Silicon Valley Review fastest growing security companies (http://thesiliconreview.com/magazines/sr-20-fastest-growing-security-companies/), and listed as the 6th fastest growing InfoSec/Cybersecurity company by CRN (http://www.crn.com/slide-shows/security/300081779/the-10-fastest-growing-cybersecurity-companies-right-now.htm/pgno/0/5).  I was also responsible and active with all M&A activities while working with a Tier 1 InfoSec investment banker in several processes.  The company is now poised to be both an  IT GRC software publisher that blends perfectly with a "best in class" cyber security and IT compliance services company.  Look for great things from Lynx Technology Partners in the years ahead.

Now Ivanti---Lumension (formerly PatchLink) merged w/FrontRange to create Heat Software early 2015. Responsible for overseeing a global team of business development directors who manage alternative revenue sources with original equipment manufacturers, strategic alliance partners, technology integration partners, VARs, and reseller channels. Collaborate with Tier 1 and 2 independent software/hardware vendors, MSP, and key strategic partners.•	Worked with more than 300 NA resellers plus 250 EMEAa and 150 Asia/Pacific region partners, multiple distributors, and 40 key original equipment manufacturing (OEM) partners.•	Built original equipment manufacturer/strategic alliance program from scratch to nation’s largest independent program for patch management, device control, and application control.   --Key OEM partners: HP, Dell (Kace Networks), VMWare, RSA, Sophos, BitDefender, Symantec, Novell, Absolute Software, ThreatTrack, Kaseya, GData, AVG, BlueCoat, Norman Software, Amazon (AWS), Emerson, Westinghouse, Microsoft, CapGemini, Fujitsu, IBM, Qualys, TrustWave, Yokogawa, Panda Software, Kaspersky, and InfoWatch.•	Built global sales force and helped direct field and inside sales revenues grow by more than 900% in a 2.5-year period while managing the entire sales force and sales engineering organization. •	Increased alternative revenues by more than 400% and managed a team of several quota carrying business development directors.  Also responsible for all key strategic relationships.•	Reported directly to the CEO as part of the e-Team and managed the entire BD team that drove net-new and expanded revenue through the complete sales cycle along with OEM account development to grow reoccurring royalties.  •	Company ranked as 14th fastest growing on Inc. 500 for private businesses.•	Developed sales enablement programs and sales training for quick on-boarding and ramping•	Achieved over 95% accuracy of foretasted pipeline for the entire tenure of sales management.

recommendations: Ken Wilson
Director, Regional Sales, West
May 11, 2012, Ken reported directly to Rich

I had the pleasure to work for Rich as a direct report over a five year period at Lumension.  As the SVP of Business Development and member of the executive team, Rich provided outstanding leadership to our team as well as the entire organization.  Rich has tremendous knowledge of the IT Security space, a keen sense for new business opportunities and a brilliant mind for contract negotiations and language. During the time I reported to Rich I found him to be extremely open to exploring new opportunities and thinking outside the normal box.  His sound reasoning skills and business acumen cultivated an atmosphere that enabled the business development team to consistently produce one fourth of the entire organizations revenues.  Rich would be an outstanding senior management talent in any growing companies’ organization.

summary: Proven performer with over 20 years experience growing startups, mid-staged, and turn-around InfoSec/CyberSecurity and healthcare software companies in a C-Level and/or E-Team capacity with a focus on business development, sales, and/or sr. management position (CEO and COO), which led to high multiple exists.  Currently, I'm the VP of Business Development at Phantom Cyber a security automation and orchestration leader in the InfoSec space.  Prior to Phantom Cyber,  I was CEO of Lynx Technology Partners, an InfoSec consulting and IT GRC Software Company where I was responsible for managing the company, formulating and executing short & long-term  strategies, interacting with Fortune 5,000 and Federal Gov't clients, employees, and other stakeholders. I also initiated all M&A activities while working with a premier banker.Before Lynx, I served as SVP of Business Development for HEAT Software (formerly FrontRange & Lumension). Prior to the merger of Lumension and FrontRange that became HEAT Software, I held a number of management and executive leadership positions at Lumension including SVP of Business Development and Worldwide Sales where I was  instrumental in successfully growing the sales force from a start-up into a world-class, international team with a strong emphasis on SaaS licensing models.  During my sales leadership tenure, Lumension revenues grew over 900% in a 2.5 year period and 400% for business development.  Additionally while leading Sales and Business Development, Lumension ranked as high as the 14th Fastest Growing Company on the Inc. 500 for private businesses.Prior to joining  Lumension /HEAT Software I served as managing director for Compuware Corp., ranked as the 5th largest software company in the world. In this role, I was responsible for leading all sales and the successful delivery of Compuware products and related services to the market. I also served in multiple management positions with Healtheon/WebMD  and McKesson HBOC,
